title: [release] Prepare v0.35
body: This release mainly consolidates a couple of patch releases.

title: *: Require at least if-watch v0.1.8
body: Ensure to include https://github.com/ipfs-rust/if-watch/pull/6 to prevent issues like https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/7794#issuecomment-778855202.

title: swarm/behaviour: Document inject_connected called for first only
Add Forest to users list
body: We've been on mainnet for a few weeks now, so seems reasonable to add here now

title: README: Remove dead-link badges
body:
Links to the libp2p matrix and discord channels are broken. Instead of replacing them, I suggest to remove them for the following reasons:

- We already have Github issues for Rust specific questions.
- We already have the forum (https://discuss.libp2p.io) for general libp2p questions. 
- As far as I know, none of the core maintainers are active in the matrix nor discord channel, thus not being able to help out.

Closes https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/issues/1948

title: Make clippy "happy".
body: Address all clippy complaints that are not purely stylistic (or even have corner cases with false positives). Ignore all "style" and "pedantic" lints. Closes #1888. There was quite a bit of unnecessary cloning, not just of peer IDs.

title: Update unsigned-varint requirement from 0.6 to 0.7

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Updates the requirements on [unsigned-varint](https://github.com/paritytech/unsigned-varint) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from unsigned-varint's changelog.

0.7.0 [2021-02-04]

  • Update asynchronous-codec to v0.6.

0.6.0 [2021-01-11]

  • Switch futures_codec to asynchronous-codec.

  • Upgrade dependencies.

0.5.1 [2020-09-08]

  • Improve docs (#36).

0.5.0 [2020-07-31]

  • Add support for no_std (#32, #33). A new feature flag std has been added. It is not enabled by default but implicitly for codec, futures and futures-codec features. It must be explicitly provided in the absence of those features if the io module should be enabled.

0.4.0 [2020-05-18]

  • Update tokio-util and futures_codec (#31).

0.3.3 [2020-04-14]

  • Optional support for nom has been added (#27).

0.3.2 [2020-03-04]

  • Replace the optional futures dependency with a futures feature that only includes futures-io and futures-util as dependencies (#26).

0.3.1 [2020-02-17]

  • Add modules io and aio to support direct reading of an unsigned-varint value from a std::io::Read or futures::io::AsyncRead type.

0.3.0 [2020-01-02]

  • Update to bytes v0.5.
  • Add support for tokio-util v0.2.
  • Remove support for tokio-codec v0.1.
  • Use #[non_exhaustive] in decode::Error and remove __Nonexhaustive.

0.2.3 [2019-10-07]

  • In addition to tokio-codec, futures_codec is now supported (#18).

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 7a90365 *: Prepare v0.7.0 (#51)
  • 5b5a449 Update asynchronous-codec requirement from 0.5 to 0.6 (#50)
  • See full diff in compare view

title: swarm/src/toggle: Ignore listen upgr errors when disabled
body:
A disabled `ToggleProtoHandler` can receive listen upgrade errors in the
following two cases:

1. Protocol negotiation on an incoming stream failed with no protocol being
   agreed on.

2. When combining `ProtocolsHandler` implementations a single `ProtocolsHandler`
   might be notified of an inbound upgrade error unrelated to its own upgrade
   logic. For example when nesting a `ToggleProtoHandler` in a
   `ProtocolsHandlerSelect` the former might receive an inbound upgrade error
   even when disabled.

`ToggleProtoHandler` should ignore the error in both of these cases.

Fixes https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/issues/2373.

title: Move some crates.
body:
This PR is on top of https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/1940 ([diff here](https://github.com/romanb/rust-libp2p/compare/rm-secio...romanb:mv-protocols)) and moves some crates in the directory structure. Specifically:

  * `protocols/plaintest` -> `transports/plaintext`
  * `protocols/deflate` -> `transports/deflate`
  * `protocols/noise` -> `transports/noise`
  * `protocols/pnet` -> `transports/pnet`

The reasoning being an attempt at clearer separation, whereby `protocols/` contains "application protocols" implemented as `NetworkBehaviour`s via `libp2p-swarm` whilst `transports/` contains transport protocols as well as upgrades for these that only depend on `libp2p-core` (if at all). All crates in `protocols/` depend on `libp2p-swarm` whereas none of the crates in `transports/` do. All of the crates in `transports/` can be used in the `Transport` construction and upgrade process. I made an attempt at documenting this structure in the updated `README` and also reflect it in the structure of the top-level `CHANGELOG`.

title: [libp2p-secio] Remove crate.
body: This PR removes the `libp2p-secio` protocol from the workspace, which has been deprecated and no longer included in the `libp2p` facade crate since https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/1729.
